chargeHist.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:26 AM Defendant Alexandra M Steinmetz in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Alexandra M Steinmetz.  Attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Detective Cory Koeppel, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Pitzo.
Cross examination by attorney Hughes.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

All parties have received the doctors reports and reviewed the report. 
Court conducts colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant believes she is competent. 
Court finds the defendant competent.
Atty Hughes is in agreement with the report. 
Atty Hughes requests a preliminary hearing, waiving time limits.

08:50 AM Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alexandra M Steinmetz in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Review hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
